page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: There are only 2 {main roads crossing through this block and public transport is very infrequent. On the B4371,in the north of the section, there is a{bus to Church Stretton}on school mornings only. On Thursdays there is a bus for shopping,also to Church Stretton. On Tuesdays and Saturdays one can reach Shrewsbury,the nearest town,nineteen miles away.These buses are run by the local family firm of Boultons, based in the nearby village of Cardington.They also run a number of day trips to places of interest throughout the year.These are well patronised. In the south of the area the Ludlow- Bridgnorth{bus,}run by the Midland Red Bus Company,passes daily along the B4368,one bus each day. Most people have a {car}a necessity in rural areas today.
